alert.note: Alert for Colleton; Hampton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 30 at 6:26PM EDT until August 30 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Colleton County in southeastern South Carolina... Hampton County in southeastern South Carolina... * Until 845 PM EDT. * At 622 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated extremely heavy rains moving across northern and central portions of Colleton County associated with Tropical Storm Idalia. As much as 2 to 5 inches of rain has already fallen. Additional intense rainfall will result in an increasing potential for flash flooding through 845 PM. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Walterboro, Colleton, Cottageville, Smoaks, Lodge, Williams, Ruffin, Padgetts, Islandton, Canadys, Ashton, Round O, Smyly, Stokes, Bells Crossroads, Rhodes Crossroads, Colleton Medical Center, Caldwell, Lowcountry Regional Airport and Springtown. Water levels along Ireland Creek are slowly rising. If living near the creek, continue to monitor water levels through this evening. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
